docs.lead_paragraph: A conservative watchdog group has asked the U.S. government's ethics agency to investigate Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton's intervention in a request for help by a deep-sea mining company after one of the firm's investors contacted her son-in-law. Clinton, then secretary of state, told a senior State Department official to look into the matter.

docs.lead_paragraph: Politicians and movements have long used the term to reference opposition or significant change. But these days, it’s most often used to describe terrorists.

docs.abstract: Emily Bazelon First Words column observes word 'radical,' long aligned with significant change, has come to be used most frequently to describe terrorist, particularly Islamic militants; holds word has been increasingly leveraged to justify discrimination against all Muslims.
